content.body: Hi. I've already touch this topic few months ago, but what do you think about adding a feature that will add link semantics to custom elements, or at least to tr? Because I saw a lot of need for the table row to behave like a link and you cannot wrap it with an a element.
Yea, actually this is what came to my mind https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/6223
vrafaeli: if there's no issue for link semantics in WICG/webcomponents it seems reasonable to open one. It won't help you with `tr` though.
content.formatted_body: vrafaeli: if there's no issue for link semantics in WICG/webcomponents it seems reasonable to open one. It won't help you with tr though.

content.body: Link "semantics" are already possible with ariaRole
It sounds like the desire is more for link behavior
You can do that with `<tr is="my-link" data-href="my-url">`
content.formatted_body: You can do that with <tr is="my-link" data-href="my-url">

content.body: Where `my-link` is a web component you write
